snippet: Dr. Cermak’s tunnel, which was roughly 10 times as long as aeronautical tunnels, could produce vertical wind currents and simulate powerful gusts.
abstract: Jack E Cermak, an engineer who was among the first to use a wind tunnel to gauge the wind’s impact on skyscrapers and who did consulting work on the World Trade Center and the Sears Tower, dies at age 89.
lead_paragraph: Dr. Cermak’s tunnel, which was roughly 10 times as long as aeronautical tunnels, could produce vertical wind currents and simulate powerful gusts.

headline.seo: Jack Cermak, Wind Tunnel Innovator, Dies at 89
headline.main: Jack Cermak, a Wind Tunnel Innovator, Dies at 89
headline.print_headline: A Wind Tunnel Innovator, Jack Cermak Dies at 89
